posts.title: Woman Arrested After Miscarriage In Georgia Under Abortion Law
top_comments: You know what will help that person deal with the trauma of a miscarriage? The trauma of an arrest. That will surely improve her life /s

"*What Should Women Who Miscarry Do?: We asked several Tifton Police Department and Tift County officials what women who miscarry should do with the remains of the fetus. So far, only Tift District Attorney Patrick Warren has answered and said typically miscarriages are not handled in this manner.*"

So they asked what she was supposed to do with the fetus and nobody had an answer.  If you can't tell her what she did wrong, why was she arrested?  Just because she probably didn't have a healthcare plan that would pay for it?

"The coroner’s office ruled it to be a occurring miscarriage"

I don't know if there's an official procedure of what to do with remains of a child when you have a miscarriage, but to jail and punish a mother for having one?   I mean... it's a miscarriage.  Did they want her to keep it in the fridge until the damn coroner can pick it up or something? Geeze! It's already traumatizing enough.
People wonder why from the 1950s-70s why women hid miscarriages? This right here.

What was she supposed to do with a dead fetus? At 19 weeks it was not close to viable. Women have been arrested for burying their stillborn children. Women miscarrying get turned away from hospitals because doctors are afraid to be accused of performing abortions. Maybe she didn’t even have the money to afford the ER visit (a whole other issue about how shitty the US is about healthcare).

Look, I’ll be real with you. I used to work with animal control. Laws are different in different places, but when we had dead animals the law was two trash bags, into the dumpster. Trash bag/dumpster seems better to me than flushing it down the toilet. Burying it in the yard like a dead pet? If there are no laws regarding this, Tifton needs to leave this woman alone.

Hey, remember when all the hippies were like "these laws are going to be used to criminalize miscarriages!" and the republicans were all "nah, not us!" and the hippies were right, just like we always are?

Another article on the same topic. This is not an isolated case


https://www.jezebel.com/georgia-police-jailed-woman-for-miscarriage-performed-autopsy-on-miscarried-fetus

I have suffered from 2 miscarriages and I can say with absolute certainty that if, while healing physically and emotionally from a miscarriage, I had also been arrested for said miscarriage I would be ready to burn everything down.  I can also say with absolute  certainty that I still have not emotionally healed from my miscarriages, and neither has my husband.  It's one of those things where you never actually get over it, but time makes it easier to go about your day.  This is heartbreaking and chilling and I wish this woman infinite strength.
If the state considers a fetus a life then a pregnant woman should be able to claim a fetus on their taxes. That is literally how it works if any logic was applied.
Wonder why the birth rates are dropping?  It is too risky to get pregnant in this country.  It opens women up to too many legal issues and possible life-threatening results.

posts.title: Utah becomes the first state to ban fluoride in public drinking water
top_comments:
If only there were some 2011 event that could teach us about [what may happen](https://www.dentistryiq.com/dentistry/research-and-news/article/55248093/why-calgary-reversed-its-decision-on-fluoride-after-10-years). 

(Calgary reversed the decision 13 years later because they noticed a significant rise in decalcification along the gumline)

"The number of children receiving IV antibiotics for dental infections at Alberta Children’s Hospital increased by 700% from 2011 to 2018. The majority of these patients were under five years old."

Edit: added more info from the article
I wish I was a dentist and I lived in Utah.

>Utah lawmakers who pushed for a ban said putting fluoride in water was too expensive.

Ah, ok.

And they tied this legislation to a tax cut for everyone in the state, right? Riiiiiight??
Just call it T Dazzle and throw it back in the water.
First Sundance moves to Boulder. Now they ban fluoride. Come on Utah, get your act together.

Calgary, Alberta did this. Just over a decade later they're reversing it. The data about how big a disaster this was is **very clear**


> The number of children receiving IV antibiotics for dental infections at Alberta Children’s Hospital increased by 700% from 2011 to 2018. The majority of these patients were under five years old.


And a study comparing Calgary with Edmonton (the other major city in Alberta)


> [2018 and 2019 data showed] 64.8 per cent of participants in Calgary had one or more cavities in their baby teeth, compared with 55.1 per cent in Edmonton participants.


Compared to 5 years earlier


> [2013 and 2014 data showed] a 56.6 per cent prevalence of dental cavities in baby teeth in Calgary, and 58.7 per cent in Edmonton.


Fluoride toothpaste doesn't get the fluoride *inside* developing bones and teeth, it only treats the *outside* of the teeth. It's good for maintenance, it's not a replacement for dietary intake for children.
I hate that this says "First" and that Utah will definitely not be the last with this Idiocracy in place.

Spent most of my life in civilization (a city) that used fluoride. I seem fine. But now I’m in rural American where they don’t use it and everybody out here’s got some fucked up teeth. So there’s that.
Grew up in Portland, Its a lovely motivator that my teeth deteriorate faster than most anyone else. like an entropy war drum. Floss kids!
Alabama is gonna be pissed that Utah out dumbed them.

posts.title: After months of cuts, State Department says it's officially shuttering USAID
top_comments: It's illegal but Trump's got immunity thanks to SCOTUS. Congress has lost all power to say where the money is spent.

In a memo distributed Friday to USAID employees and obtained by ABC News, Jeremy Lewin, the agency's new deputy director and a former Department of Government Efficiency official, wrote that the State Department "intends to assume responsibility for many of USAID's functions and its ongoing programming."

The State Department "will seek to retire USAID's independent operation" immediately and "assess" whether to rehire some unknown number of officials to "assume the responsible administration of USAID's remaining life-saving and strategic aid programming," the memo said.

"This transfer will significantly enhance efficiency, accountability, uniformity, and strategic impact in delivering foreign assistance programs -- allowing our nation and President to speak with one voice in foreign affairs," according to the memo.

"It will also obviate the need for USAID to continue operating as an independent establishment," the memo said.

As part of the move, the memo said, "all non-statutory positions at USAID will be eliminated."...
The jobs report Friday is going to be a bloodbath

Imagine the progress in America if you didn't have to waste time rebuilding from smoldering ruins after a Republican administration every 4-8 years. And this time it's so bad, there might not even be anything left.

This update adds 73 cases to the number of reported cases in Texas associated with the outbreak. Tuesday’s update added 18 cases. Last Friday's update added 30 cases. Last Tuesday’s update added 20 new cases.

One new hospitalization (up to 41 from 40) was reported, while no new deaths were reported for Texas.

Kansas has begun reporting cases that are, according to authorities, possibly linked to the Texas outbreak. They reported 10 cases last Friday and reported 13 additional cases yesterday.

https://www.kansas.com/news/state/article302927824.html

Kansas will be updating their case counts on Wednesdays.

> Wisconsin Attorney General Josh Kaul sued Musk in state court, seeking to temporarily restrain Musk from further promoting his promise to give away two $1 million checks or making any further payments to Wisconsin voters. "Greetings, former allies!"
Europeans: let them eat cake!

Nobody is going to help. The word help is gone. My assumption is they don't outright say no, but are calling in demands for providing supplies. Even if you disagree with her opinion, she has a right to say it.

Don't stop protesting boycotting, or this country will fall to government power abuse.

I applaud them for their bravery. We need to continue to speak truth to power.

*“It is the immigrant communities, the undocumented communities, the working communities who are leading this struggle for our own liberation,” another said earlier.   Local residents of all ages attended the protest in addition to Tufts students, faculty and staff.*

posts.title: Measles update: Texas reports West Texas outbreak has seen 400 cases since January
top_comments: You call it measles, Texans call it Freedom Cough

Well this is a interesting thing to watch.  The most infectious disease on the planet to date versus a mostly vaccinated public.  So it looks like it will just sit there and simmer.  Never going away and never getting free.  Unless it mutates that is.

Remember, denying vaccines was never about safety.

It's because scientists are the enemy, and the enemy is never allowed to be right about something.

This update adds 73 cases to the number of reported cases in Texas associated with the outbreak. Tuesday’s update added 18 cases. Last Friday's update added 30 cases. Last Tuesday’s update added 20 new cases.

One new hospitalization (up to 41 from 40) was reported, while no new deaths were reported for Texas.

Kansas has begun reporting cases that are, according to authorities, possibly linked to the Texas outbreak. They reported 10 cases last Friday and reported 13 additional cases yesterday.

https://www.kansas.com/news/state/article302927824.html

Kansas will be updating their case counts on Wednesdays.
Their Vitamin A supplements from Amazon must have been delayed

It's now in 20 states. The total for the country is 483 cases as of March 27th. 

[https://www.cdc.gov/measles/data-research/index.html#cdc\_data\_surveillance\_section\_10-measles-cases-in-2025](https://www.cdc.gov/measles/data-research/index.html#cdc_data_surveillance_section_10-measles-cases-in-2025)
And this should have been preventable!
MAHA is a death cult. This is so obvious.

God I can't wait for the observational public health study that will come out of this one to try and show everyone how important getting vaccinated is, but at the same time there's no point trying to educate the indoctrinated.

posts.title: Woman Arrested After Miscarriage In Georgia Under Abortion Law
top_comments: You know what will help that person deal with the trauma of a miscarriage? The trauma of an arrest. That will surely improve her life /s

"*What Should Women Who Miscarry Do?: We asked several Tifton Police Department and Tift County officials what women who miscarry should do with the remains of the fetus. So far, only Tift District Attorney Patrick Warren has answered and said typically miscarriages are not handled in this manner.*"

So they asked what she was supposed to do with the fetus and nobody had an answer.  If you can't tell her what she did wrong, why was she arrested?  Just because she probably didn't have a healthcare plan that would pay for it?

"The coroner’s office ruled it to be a occurring miscarriage"

I don't know if there's an official procedure of what to do with remains of a child when you have a miscarriage, but to jail and punish a mother for having one?   I mean... it's a miscarriage.  Did they want her to keep it in the fridge until the damn coroner can pick it up or something? Geeze! It's already traumatizing enough.
People wonder why from the 1950s-70s why women hid miscarriages? This right here.

What was she supposed to do with a dead fetus? At 19 weeks it was not close to viable. Women have been arrested for burying their stillborn children. Women miscarrying get turned away from hospitals because doctors are afraid to be accused of performing abortions. Maybe she didn’t even have the money to afford the ER visit (a whole other issue about how shitty the US is about healthcare).

Look, I’ll be real with you. I used to work with animal control. Laws are different in different places, but when we had dead animals the law was two trash bags, into the dumpster. Trash bag/dumpster seems better to me than flushing it down the toilet. Burying it in the yard like a dead pet? If there are no laws regarding this, Tifton needs to leave this woman alone.

Hey, remember when all the hippies were like "these laws are going to be used to criminalize miscarriages!" and the republicans were all "nah, not us!" and the hippies were right, just like we always are?

Another article on the same topic. This is not an isolated case


https://www.jezebel.com/georgia-police-jailed-woman-for-miscarriage-performed-autopsy-on-miscarried-fetus

I have suffered from 2 miscarriages and I can say with absolute certainty that if, while healing physically and emotionally from a miscarriage, I had also been arrested for said miscarriage I would be ready to burn everything down.  I can also say with absolute  certainty that I still have not emotionally healed from my miscarriages, and neither has my husband.  It's one of those things where you never actually get over it, but time makes it easier to go about your day.  This is heartbreaking and chilling and I wish this woman infinite strength.
If the state considers a fetus a life then a pregnant woman should be able to claim a fetus on their taxes. That is literally how it works if any logic was applied.
Wonder why the birth rates are dropping?  It is too risky to get pregnant in this country.  It opens women up to too many legal issues and possible life-threatening results.

posts.title: After months of cuts, State Department says it's officially shuttering USAID
top_comments: It's illegal but Trump's got immunity thanks to SCOTUS. Congress has lost all power to say where the money is spent.

In a memo distributed Friday to USAID employees and obtained by ABC News, Jeremy Lewin, the agency's new deputy director and a former Department of Government Efficiency official, wrote that the State Department "intends to assume responsibility for many of USAID's functions and its ongoing programming."

The State Department "will seek to retire USAID's independent operation" immediately and "assess" whether to rehire some unknown number of officials to "assume the responsible administration of USAID's remaining life-saving and strategic aid programming," the memo said.

"This transfer will significantly enhance efficiency, accountability, uniformity, and strategic impact in delivering foreign assistance programs -- allowing our nation and President to speak with one voice in foreign affairs," according to the memo.

"It will also obviate the need for USAID to continue operating as an independent establishment," the memo said.

As part of the move, the memo said, "all non-statutory positions at USAID will be eliminated."...
The jobs report Friday is going to be a bloodbath

Imagine the progress in America if you didn't have to waste time rebuilding from smoldering ruins after a Republican administration every 4-8 years. And this time it's so bad, there might not even be anything left.
They're going to regret this for lots of reasons.   Destroying something because you don't know what it's doing doesn't mean it wasn't doing something important.
It's so great to see Chuck Schumer's plan of "Do nothing and roll over to expose my belly" totally worked. Trump's totally been neutered since.
I'm so ashamed of this country.
Goodbye american soft power.
Holy fuck. Decades of soft power gone in an instant. People quickly starving and dying without medicine. There will be consequences.
Once again releasing usaid news end of week like the cowards they are.

top_comments: Are we having fun yet?

EDIT: Lol. On the top right under 'latest market news' there's a headline for 600 points and clicking on it takes you to the headline for 700 points. Silly website.
Sec Treasury Bennet just included me in a chat about the declining stock market.  Will keep you all posted.

Right now down 735. 

It would need to fall another 700 points or so to hit the dip it was at a couple weeks ago. Another drop of that magnitude would take it to summer last year.
Somebody's winning.  It's just not us.
Note to America - don’t elect idiots & crooks.
Just wait until the unemployment figures come in.

I mean is anyone surprised? I literally can't think of any positive economic indicators or good news on the horizon. We haven't even started feeling the effects of the tariffs and the feds yanking billions of dollars of spending out of the economy, unemployment is going to spike with all the layoffs over the last couple of months, and inflation is taking off again.

I've moved mostly into cash. I keep hearing people repeat a dumb slogan: "Time in the market > timing the market!!!" Maybe that's true sometimes, but not times like now where there is literally zero reason for the market to go up, and a zillion reasons it will continue going down.
